Node.definition: = exclamation expressing emotion concerning suffering that will come over an individual or nation

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= action by which humans say things that not true in order to deceive or mislead others
= state or process by which a location is dominated by a certain event, to the extent that it dominates everything else, ◄ as if it were completely filled with that event
= process by which an object moves away from its location
literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare
= strip of leather or length of cord fastened to a handle, ► used for beating a person or urging on an animal

= ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made as a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outher rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground, and occasionally for other purposes, such as threshing grain

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= action by which a horse walks at a fast pace, with all the feet off the ground together in each stride
= open vehicle with two or four wheels, pulled by one or more horses; ◄ made or wood and iron; ► used in war or for travelling
= action with which humans or animals move in a quick and light or lively way
= horse; ► primarily used for soldiers to ride on, but also for agricultural purposes|= soldier riding a horse
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = causative action by which a rider causes his horse to raise itself up on its hind legs
= state/process by which objects reflect light
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
= process by which an object reflects light, often because it has been polished
= a long, straight rod, usually made of wood, with a sharp iron (בַּרְזֶל) head or point; used for piercing by thrusting; its length varied from the height of a man to much longer
= state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object
= state in which objects are large in quantity
= body of an animal or human that has died or been killed; ► source of pollution and impurity

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= the physical structure, including the bones, flesh, and organs, of a person or animal, either alive or dead
= process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure
= the physical structure, including the bones, flesh, and organs, of a person or animal, either alive or dead
= action by which humans engage in non sanctioned worship, ◄ described in terms of prostitution
= woman that sells her body for payment, making of this her profession; ≈ often associated with shame and sinful behavior
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others
literally: mistress of sorcery; hence: = woman who engages in sorcery
= action by which humans make an effort to gain control over humans, animals, or deities ◄ through rituals and incantations
= causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= action by which humans engage in non sanctioned worship, ◄ described in terms of prostitution
= a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics
= action by which humans make an effort to gain control over humans, animals, or deities ◄ through rituals and incantations
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

= causative action by which someone causes someone else to take off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which brings shame on that person and to those who stand in a close relation to them
= the part of a coat or dress that hangs below the waist
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans to perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= state in which humans wear no clothing, ≈ which is regarded as shameful
= state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition
= an object that is regarded as unclean and therefore treated as utterly detestable
= action by which humans or deities treat (other) humans, deities or things that belong to God with disrespect
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= a person or object that people want to see because of its unusual looks

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

= town; ◄ located in northern Mesopotamia near Mosul on the east bank of the Tigris (חִדֶּקֶל) ► built by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) after the flood (מַבּוּל) ancient capital of Assyria (אַשּׁוּר) preached against by the prophet Jonah (יֹונָה)

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
literally: to shake (one's) head); hence: = action by which humans turn their head from one side to the other ► to express sympathy

= referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out from which location a person or object originates; ≈ sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that location does not exist
= action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= state in which people live in a condition of well being
= state in which an object has been placed in a certain location with the intention that it will stay there for an extended period of time
= a body of water flowing to and from the Nile river, whether in the form of a manmade canal or a subsidiary river branch, especially those of the Nile delta region
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

meaning unsure; probably: = a structure surrounding a town, outside the main wall; ◄ made out of of stones or bricks; ► provides strength and security to the town; ≈ sometimes used metaphorically to denote someone who offers protection
literally: the sea; hence: = a large river flowing from the south to the north through Egypt into the Mediterranean Sea
literally: the sea; hence: = a large river flowing from the south to the north through Egypt into the Mediterranean Sea

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
= state in which humans have physical, political, or military strength
= ethnic group and their territory, ◄ regarded as descendants of Cush, son of Ham (חָם)
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= ethnic group; ◄ regarded as descendants of Ham (חָם) son of Noah (נֹחַ)
= land and ethnic group ◄ located west of Egypt (מִצְרַיִם) ► often fighting in Egyptian army
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier
marker pointing out that the information that follows is an unexpected consequence of what has been stated before
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= state in which people, animals or objects have been forcibly carried off; ► in the case of people, into slavery or exile

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= a person of a young age, usually before puberty
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= area outside of living quarters; ► used as thoroughfare

Node.gloss: to be honorable|to be worthy of honor|to be renowned
Node.definition: = state in which humans and deities are regarded as worthy of honor and respect
= action by which an object is caused to move from someone's hands toward a surface or place nearby
= the process of arriving at a decision based on casting the lot
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom
= causative action by which humans tie (part of) the body of (other) humans or animals with a chain (רַתֹּוק) ► in order to keep them under control
= chains or shackles attached to the feet of a captive ► in order to restrain their movements

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= a referent to a female participant addressed in a discourse
= process by which humans become intoxicated ◄ as a result of having too much alcohol

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= a referent to a female participant addressed in a discourse
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality

= large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security

= a tree that reaches a height of 5 8 m, with a round crown and very deep roots; its fruit is about the size of a hen’s egg and can be green, yellow, purple, or brown depending on the type; ◄ Ficus carica; ► the fruits are sweet and soft; ≈ the image of peace and happiness in Israel was: “every man under his vine and under his fig tree
= the earliest agricultural outcomes of the season; ► with an important function in the religious offerings system; ≈ often with a religious connotation
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
a long rigid piece of wood, metal, or similar material, attached in horizontal position to a gate so that it cannot be opened from the outside
= state of being surrounded by a group of people ► for purposes of war
= causative action by which humans let down a bucket like container attached to a rope into a well in order to draw water from it

Node.gloss: to strengthen|to give strength, to fortify|to repair|to let prevail
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause humans and objects to be strong in a physical, political, or military sense
= area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security

= wet soil;◄ moistened by rain or because of its proximity to a body of water; ► can be used for pottery or bricks; ≈ regarded as cheap, easily obtainable and workable material for making basic items; otherwise as a valueless substance or an obstacle for movement

= stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material

Node.gloss: to seize|to hold|to take hold|to grasp|to handle
Node.definition: = action by which humans take hold of other humans or objects with their hands; the agent role is often extended figuratively to include objects, deities and certain conditions
exact meaning unknown: = small, rectangular wooden container (about 20‑25 by 10 centimeters) ► used to form bricks in equal sizes; or: = large outdoor oven ► for baking bricks to harden them
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
literally: to cut off (people); hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans to die a violent death
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

term found primarily in poetic contexts: = six legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw

Node.gloss: to multiply oneself|to make oneself numerous
Node.definition: = action by which humans make themselves numerous

term found primarily in poetic contexts: = six legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw

Node.gloss: to multiply oneself|to make oneself numerous
Node.definition: = action by which humans make themselves numerous

= six legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten

= celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

term found primarily in poetic contexts: = six legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw

Node.gloss: to cast (one's) skin|to shed (one's) skin|to advance upon (an area or people)|to make a raid|to spread (one's) wings
Node.definition: meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which a locust sheds its skin|= action by which a group of armed people makes a sudden move in order to attack the people living there and steal their possessions|meaning unsure; possibly: = action by which an animal extends its wings in order to fly away
= action by which a winged living creature moves through the air by flapping its wings

= six legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten
= one responsible for overseeing and/or reporting on the activities of others, in an organized network; ◄ perhaps derived from the Assyrian word for tablet writer

= six legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten; ≈ associated with large quantities and destruction
= state in which an individual or group of people dwells at a certain location for a limited period of time and often for a specific purpose
= a continuous vertical structure, usually made of natural stones that encloses or divides an area of land; ≈ associated with security

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referring to a state of low temperature
= process by which the sun appears in the morning to provide light and warmth to the world; ≈ associated with a new period of well being
= action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= state in which humans or animals are in a state of a relatively light sleep; ≈ sometimes associated with death, sometimes with being inactive
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= person in a position of leadership, either within the community or within the army
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals to come together as a group for a common purpose

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state in which an event is very serious in nature
= area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by an act of aggression
= causative action by which someone strikes the palms of their hands together ► in joy

Node.gloss: to clap (one's) hands (for joy or glee)
Node.definition: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = to strike the palms of one's hands together ≈ as a symbol of joy and appreciation

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
